tika.dc.description:
• Laura Caldwell's first novel, Burning The Map, was selected by Barnes & Noble.com as one of the Best of 2002 and had an NSR over 50%.
  • Laura's second novel, A Clean Slate, received a starred review from Booklist.
  • The Year of Living Famously explores our society's obsession with celebrity and one woman's place on the edge of unwanted fame.
  • Caldwell is a poster child for the genre, and an incredible self-promoter.
  • As a very capable author, Caldwell is able to weave complex and thought-provoking themes into her stories, while still appealing to the traditional chick-lit market.
dc.subject: Fiction
General
